title: In game ping has increased in game from ~27ms to constant 117ms for the past 4 days, reposting
body:
I'm reposting my post from 3 days for ago, since I didn't get my issue resolved or my questions answered and it seems to have died. Here's the original: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/sfQEH4ok-in-game-ping-has-increased-in-game-from-27ms-to-constant-117ms-since-yesterday-isp-or-riot-issue

I live in Ontario, Canada, around an hour outside of Toronto.

I played a ranked game 4 days ago and noticed my in game ping was at a **constant 117ms**, whereas it usually sat at around 27ms. **Restarting client, computer, and router all had no effect.** Furthermore, **no other network traffic was affected.** Ping tests to various websites (google etc) resulted in their usual latency of 15-30ms. 

I have also ran the Hextech Repair Tool, tried a wired connection, flushed DNS / Renewed IP, basically I've done everything to ensure it was not an issue on my end.

This issue persists to this day, 4 days later - I'd like to emphasize this is not an issue with my home network, but something clearly farther down the line.

Here are the results from a tracert test ran using WinMTR, [HERE](http://pastebin.com/f9kFRw6L)

Any information would be appreciated.

replies.body:
I looked over the traceroute you sent, and I noticed that in the very first line you have a "worst ping" of 51. This could be a sign that something is up with your router or modem, as you typically want to see a 0 or 1 in that first line. 

If you already have a high ping before your connection leaves your home network, we should go through our [Connection Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to check for any instabilities there first.

Hit me up if you have any questions!

I'm sorry but that does not help me whatsoever, I think its clear that this is NOT a local network thing as I have stated multiple times. In my previous thread I was given the exact same advice by Porocules, and I gave him the exact same explanation. That test was done on my laptop over a 2.4ghz wifi connection far from my router as I did not think my local network made any difference, so naturally a couple packets will be delayed because of interference.

No other network traffic is affected. 

My ping is not spiking but is at a CONSTANT 115MS+, which is VERY different from lag spikes experienced due to weak local network connections.

I have said that I've done a lot of trouble shooting on my end, including following your connection guide, and it doesn't resolve my problem.

It has been 5 days and the only 2 response I've received from Riot have been the exact same and neither actually address the issue.

"Oh your car is on fire? Well I see that your air pressure in your tire is kinda low, have you tried fixing that?"
Same thing, except I got it just now. My MS stays on 106 MS and goes no lower, which happened after a random lag spike appeared while I was in a game and it stays at 106 after decreasing.

May sound dumb, but I had my ping jump from 68ish to 115 for like 3 weeks and couldnt figure out why the hell it happened either. I hadnt changed anything and it made no sense. Im thinking I just solved it because my computer is bluetooth capable and I am connected over wifi. I believe I was getting a bad wifi signal because my computer trying to establish a bluetooth connection to my phone. Once I turned off the bluetooth on my computer my ping dropped to normal instantly.
I have the exact same problem does anyone know the fix.. my internet is always good execpt when i get ingame in LoL please help

Same exact thing happened to me, I had a normal stable 30 ping and all of a sudden my ping just went up to 90 and its such a huge difference to the game play. I searched around and others are having the same problem but no one is giving advice out on fixing it

I have been having the same issue. My internet connection is strong as ever and I didn't have this problem up until a week or two ago (Maybe more since I don't play League consistently) but last match I broke my record by going up to 400 ms most frequently. Random spikes of anything over 300 ms is what I'm accustomed to at this point meanwhile other games I play connect just fine, what the hell Riot!
Has your base ping increased at all? Like I occasionally received spikes too, but now it refuses to EVER drop below 115.

My base ping hasn't increased, I go down to anything between 20 - 60, and then spikes to 300 - 400... After that spike, it slowly drops to anything between 200 - 300 and then goes back to normal, below 115 definitely. Gonna play a match today and gather what I get now.

Ah, sounds like your issue is separate from mine. Mine is a constant increase to 115ms, whereas yours is ping spiking. If you're on a wifi network try a wired connection, see what background processes your computer is running, etc. Most of the time when I get a lag spike it's because an application somewhere on the network decided to download an update (Steam, Windows, phone on wifi)

Interesting, I'll have to turn off whatever's running in the background... Chrome isn't that problematic because I get the same results with or without it running. Thank you! I'll be on the lookout for what may be causing your lag. Best of luck to you!
